question.questionA: Stems jointed, unbranched or with whorls of branches at the nodes; leaves not green, united into a scarious sheath.
Leaves small (<5 mm), numerous, clothing dichotomously branching stems; micro- and megasporangia in the axils of sporophylls arranged in a strobilus.
question.questionB: Leaves medium or large (>10 mm); sporangia not in strobili.
Leaves non-linear, often triangular or pinnate.

question.questionA: Semi-aquatic plants; leaves cruciform, divided into four leaflets.
question.questionB: Terrestrial plants; leaves simple or pinnately divided.

question.questionA: Plants with distinct narrow-bladed fertile and broad-bladed sterile pinnae.
question.questionB: Fertile pinnae not obviously narrower than any non-fertile pinnae.

question.questionA: Plants with an upper fertile and a lower sterile frond; the fertile: mainly non-photosynthetic,stalked and pinnate;the sterile:sessile,green, entire or pinnately lobed.
question.questionB: Both fertile and sterile fronds pinnately divided.

question.questionA: Sori covered by deflexed leaf-margin which has scarious fimbriate border; small strongly scented mountain fern.
Sori linear; lower margin of indusium straight.
Sori oblong; lower margin of indusium curved.
